body: Could you provide the full error message please; since it does work for you in the past, itâ€™s likely your video - does it have more than 3 RGB channels?

I think the video is a normal 3-channel video in mp4 format.

I think because you are only finding 21 outliers, and you extracted 20 already beforehand, it can't save over the image again. If you want to find more frames to label, perhaps adjust the epsilon to be lower, i.e. 75 and see if you find more than 21 outliers...
Hmmm... how do you see that I "extracted 20 already beforehand" ?   If I did, it was accidental and I never dealt with them - so how can I 'start over' ?

you can delete the frames from the folder (with video name 3315), and try again... 

I am looking at this output here, which repeats:

```
deeplabcut.extract_outlier_frames(config_path,['/home/john/Projects/Epona-John
```

It also seems you are getting a really slim extracted frames, i.e. only 21, so perhaps then pick only 5 of those, vs 20... cutting it close ;)

I looked in the folder where it should be writing out the frames - there were some there, so I deleted them and started fresh.  It would write out 2 or 3 or 4, and then crash as before - then I'd run the same command again, and it would write a couple more before crashing.  By running the command about 15 times, I got all the frames written out -- and could go on to merge_dataset and launch training....

So, something a bit spooky going on.  Not sure what it means.  I'm not sweating it for now.  I'll let you know if I see it again and have more data...
